Atrial fibrillation , hypertension , aortic valve disease , family history of coronary artery disease , hypothyroidism , and tobacco use . PRINCIPAL PROCEDURE : Percutaneous heart valvuloplasty . HISTORY AND REASON FOR HOSPITALIZATION : The patient is a 83-year-old woman under the care of Dr. Lenni Be with a diagnosis of rheumatic mitral stenosis . She had a history of increasing dyspnea on exertion and shortness of breath , orthopnea , and paroxysmal nocturnal dyspnea . In addition , she noted palpitations but had a negative Holter monitor for tachy arrhythmias . She is currently New York Heart Association functional class 3 . A 2D echocardiogram showed mitral stenosis with a peak gradient of 23 , mean of 15 and a calculated mitral valve area of 0.9 cm. squared . Her echo score was 10 . There was more involvement of the lateral commissure and mild mitral regurgitation . She also had mild aortic insufficiency , moderate tricuspid regurgitation with an estimated right ventricular systolic pressure of 74 . There was evidence of left-to-right shunting consistent with a patent foramen ovale prior to the trans-septal procedure . She is now referred for PMV . Jugular venous pressure normal and carotids normal . Chest was clear . First sound was increased but variable intensity , the second sound normally split with an increased P2 . Examination of the abdomen was benign . There was no edema and there were good femoral pulses bilaterally . SUMMARY : This was a woman with mitral stenosis referred for PMV . HOSPITAL COURSE AND TREATMENT : The patient was taken to the Cardiac Catheterization Laboratory where she was found to have a valve area of 0.6 cm. squared with a mean gradient of 20 . She had her sheathes removed without incident and was transferred to the floor for observation overnight . She had a transthoracic echocardiogram performed prior to discharge , the results of which are pending at the time of this dictation . The procedure was deemed to be successful and the patient was ultimately discharged on Coumadin , Plendil , Synthroid , Vitamin E , multivitamin , Ginkgo , Lasix , Potassium supplementation and Atenolol . She will follow up with her primary care physician , Dr. Lupevickette Ca and her Cardiologist , Dr. Lenni Be . DWAINCO L.
